@graph.name: Crystallized Beet Multigrain Thins! Vegan cookie - Vegan Richa

itemListElement.name: Crystallized Beet Multigrain Thins! Vegan cookie

@graph.name: Crystallized Beet Multigrain Thins. Vegan Cookie.
@graph.description: Crystallized Beet Multigrain Thins. Delicious, pink vegan cookies made with beet syrup and crystallized beet chunks, so delicious! Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1/2  medium beet ((peeled and chopped into 1/8 inch cubes))
4 tablespoon raw sugar or jaggery ((raw granulated sugar is usually sweeter than powdered sugar))
1-2 tablespoons Raw turbinado sugar or jaggery or sweetener of choice ((I used 1 Tbsp for mild sweetness.))
1 tablespoon roasted Cashew butter ((Homemade nut butter recipes))
1 tablespoon virgin coconut oil (or vegan butter like Earth Balance)
1 tablespoons quinoa ((blended coarsely or quinoa flour ( or use oats coarse flour, if you don't have quinoa))
3 tablespoons oat flour ((Bobâ€™s Red Mill Organic Old Fashioned))

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, add a cup of water and bring to a boil. Add the sugar, and mix well. Simmer for 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan, add a cup of water and bring to a boil. Add the sugar, and mix well. Simmer for 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the chopped beet, cinnamon, ginger powder and cook on low heat for 30-40 minutes or until the syrup thickens and starts to bubble up and just about starts to crystallize.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the chopped beet, cinnamon, ginger powder and cook on low heat for 30-40 minutes or until the syrup thickens and starts to bubble up and just about starts to crystallize.

recipeInstructions.text: I got about 5 Tablespoons of thick syrup with beet in it. You can remove the beet pieces and coat them with powdered sugar and keep refrigerated for a few weeks. I left them in the syrup, since I was going to use them within the next few days.
recipeInstructions.name: I got about 5 Tablespoons of thick syrup with beet in it. You can remove the beet pieces and coat them with powdered sugar and keep refrigerated for a few weeks. I left them in the syrup, since I was going to use them within the next few days.

recipeInstructions.text: I used about 2/3 of the this mixture for the cookies, that is 3 Tablespoons of the syrup with beet pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: I used about 2/3 of the this mixture for the cookies, that is 3 Tablespoons of the syrup with beet pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: The remaining syrup went in some multigrain pancakes, which turned out an amazing. pink, fluffy with them fun beet chunks! My multigrain pancake recipe here.
recipeInstructions.name: The remaining syrup went in some multigrain pancakes, which turned out an amazing. pink, fluffy with them fun beet chunks! My multigrain pancake recipe here.

itemListElement.text: In a bowl, mix the flax meal and hot water and let sit for a minute.
itemListElement.name: In a bowl, mix the flax meal and hot water and let sit for a minute.

itemListElement.text: Add in the room temperature cashew butter, coconut oil, sugar and beet syrup(without the beet pieces) and mix well by hand or by hand mixer until the mixture feels light. The cashew butter I used is store bought and it takes a while to mix up. Mix and let sit for a few minutes and then mix again.
itemListElement.name: Add in the room temperature cashew butter, coconut oil, sugar and beet syrup(without the beet pieces) and mix well by hand or by hand mixer until the mixture feels light. The cashew butter I used is store bought and it takes a while to mix up. Mix and let sit for a few minutes and then mix again.

itemListElement.text: Blend/grind the quinoa and oats to a coarse flour along with the baking powder and keep aside.
itemListElement.name: Blend/grind the quinoa and oats to a coarse flour along with the baking powder and keep aside.

itemListElement.text: To the oil and sugar mix, add in the ground quinoa, ground oats, salt, wheat pastry flour, self rising flour, beet pieces and lemon juice and mix till just about combined. Add in more wheat flour if needed to get gooey muffin mixture kind of consistency. If you added too much flour, the mixture will get too stiff, then add in a teaspoon oil and/or lemon juice to make it gooey. Keep this mixture more flowy and gooey, more like a thick batter and unlike the oat cookie dough, where the mixture is slightly stiff.
itemListElement.name: To the oil and sugar mix, add in the ground quinoa, ground oats, salt, wheat pastry flour, self rising flour, beet pieces and lemon juice and mix till just about combined. Add in more wheat flour if needed to get gooey muffin mixture kind of consistency. If you added too much flour, the mixture will get too stiff, then add in a teaspoon oil and/or lemon juice to make it gooey. Keep this mixture more flowy and gooey, more like a thick batter and unlike the oat cookie dough, where the mixture is slightly stiff.

itemListElement.text: Oil a spoon and pick up tablespoons full batter-y dough, drop them and flatten on parchment paper. Thinner the better.! Shape with oiled hands.
itemListElement.name: Oil a spoon and pick up tablespoons full batter-y dough, drop them and flatten on parchment paper. Thinner the better.! Shape with oiled hands.

itemListElement.text: Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 11-14 minutes(add minutes depending on the thickness of the cookie). The cookies should not be runny or liquidy when done and just about starting to brown on the edges.
itemListElement.name: Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 11-14 minutes(add minutes depending on the thickness of the cookie). The cookies should not be runny or liquidy when done and just about starting to brown on the edges.

itemListElement.text: Take cookies off baking tray and cool on rack for a few minutes if you can:)
itemListElement.name: Take cookies off baking tray and cool on rack for a few minutes if you can:)

itemListElement.text: Store in airtight container for a week or so. Let me know how yours turn out! Have a fun Tuesday!
itemListElement.name: Store in airtight container for a week or so. Let me know how yours turn out! Have a fun Tuesday!

@graph.keywords: pink cookies, vegan cookies, vegetable cookies
